solution:
The relative rotation of the primed system implies

$$\hat{\mathbf{x}}' = \frac{\hat{\mathbf{x}} + \hat{\mathbf{y}}}{\sqrt{2}}$$

Now we see that

$$
\begin{split}
\hat{\mathbf{x}}'\cdot\hat{\mathbf{x}}' &=
\frac{1}{2}(
\hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{x}} +
\hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}} +
\hat{\mathbf{y}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{x}} +
\hat{\mathbf{y}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}}
) \\ &=
1 + \hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}} = 1
\end{split}
$$

since $\hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{x}}=1$ and $\hat{\mathbf{y}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}}=1$.

Therefore $\hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}}$ must be zero.
statement: Given that (1) the dot product of a unit vector with itself is unity and (2) this relation is valid in all (rotated) coordinate systems, show that $\hat{\mathbf{x}}'\cdot\hat{\mathbf{x}}'=1$ (with the primed system rotated 45° about the $z$-axis relative to the unprimed) implies that $\hat{\mathbf{x}}\cdot\hat{\mathbf{y}}=0$.
author: Arfken & Weber
